sentences.en: A group of senators plans to filibuster a measure that would permit drilling in Alaska.
sentences.cn: 参议员们试图阻挠一项允许在阿拉斯加州钻探石油的议案获得通过。

sentences.en: Alaska and Hawaii were dependencies of the United States.
sentences.cn: 阿拉斯加和夏威夷过去是美国的属地。

sentences.en: Alaska boomed with the discovery of oil.
sentences.cn: 阿拉斯加因发现石油而突然繁荣起来.

sentences.en: Alaska is a state of ample size.
Alaska is at the western extremity of North America.
sentences.cn: 阿拉斯加在北美西部的尽头.
阿拉斯加是我们最北的州.

sentences.en: Alaska still is a land of iceberg and polar bear.
sentences.cn: 阿拉斯加现在仍是冰山和北极熊的世界.

sentences.en: Alaska was once possessed by Russia.
sentences.cn: 阿拉斯加一度曾是俄国的领土.

sentences.en: Gambell involved a grant of oil and gas leases covering tracts offshore of Alaska.
sentences.cn: 坎贝尔一案涉及到阿拉斯加近海岸的一片油气田的租借权问题.

sentences.en: Gold was the loadstone that drew men to Alaska.
sentences.cn: 金子是具有吸引力的东西,它引诱人前往阿拉斯加州.

sentences.en: Like I said, perfect, if you live in Alaska.
sentences.cn: 像我说过的，完美，如果你住在阿拉斯加的话。

sentences.en: My great - grandmother was sentenced to Alaska for witchraft.
sentences.cn: 我的 曾祖母 因为行巫术被判流放到阿拉斯加.

sentences.en: Once they went camping with friends who had moved to Alaska.
sentences.cn: 有一次，他们和几个搬到阿拉斯加的朋友去野营。

sentences.en: The Dall sheep range from Alaska to British Columbia.
sentences.cn: 多尔大角羊分布于从阿拉斯加到不列颠哥伦比亚一带.

sentences.en: The Tundra Times, a weekly newspaper in Alaska, ceased publication this week.
sentences.cn: 阿拉斯加的周报《苔原时报》本周停刊了。

sentences.en: There was a bank in Alaska that had signed the agreements.
sentences.cn: 有一家在阿拉斯加的银行在协议书上签了字.

sentences.en: They saw many seals off the Coast of Alaska.
sentences.cn: 他们在阿拉斯加海岸外看见很多海豹.

sentences.en: They were shipwrecked off the coast of Alaska.
sentences.cn: 他们在阿拉斯加外海遇海难.

phrases.tran_cn: 阿拉斯加山脉（美国阿拉斯加州南部山脉）
